meanings.definition: A long, slender projection of a nerve cell that conducts electrical impulses away from the cell body.
meanings.sent1: The axons in our body help send messages to our brain.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how axons transmit signals in the nervous system.
meanings.sent3: The axons in the neuron were like messengers delivering urgent news.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts traveled along the axons like lightning bolts.
meanings.sent5: The axons, like tiny wires, carried important information throughout the body.

meanings.definition: The part of a nerve cell that transmits information to other cells.
meanings.sent1: Axons play a crucial role in communication between nerve cells.
meanings.sent2: Signals travel through axons to connect different parts of the body.
meanings.sent3: The axons in the brain were like busy telephone lines.
meanings.sent4: His words traveled down the axons, reaching every corner of the body.
meanings.sent5: The axons acted as messengers, relaying information from one cell to another.
